Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Armadillidin Q (Gly-rich; natural AMPs; Terrestrial Isopod, Crustaceans, arthropods,  invertebrates, animals, XXA; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature:
APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 98.1% similarity toArmadillidin H. Rich in glycines (47%). There are six repeated motifs GGGF(H/N)(R/S). Active against B. megaterium F04 (MBC 4.75 uM) and P. syringae DC3000 (MBC 1.18 uM). Very rapid killing started at 30 s and 5 min. Membrane targeting.
.
Literature Information.Author: Verdon J, Coutos-Thevenot P, Rodier MH, Landon C, Depayras S, Noel C, La Camera S, Moumen B, Greve P, Bouchon D, Berjeaud JM, Braquart-Varnier C.2016
Literature Information.Title: Armadillidin H, a Glycine-Rich Peptide from the Terrestrial Crustacean Armadillidium vulgare, Displays an Unexpected Wide Antimicrobial Spectrum with Membranolytic Activity
